Understate: The claim understates the fact that air conditioning systems using Freon will not have to be replaced by 2020, but it will become increasingly difficult to obtain the necessary refrigerant.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that air conditioners using Freon will have to be replaced by 2020.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all air conditioners that use Freon will need to be replaced by 2020, without considering alternative options or solutions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that air conditioning systems using Freon can continue to operate by obtaining the necessary refrigerant through alternative means or sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the production and import of HCFC-22, the principal component of Freon, will no longer be allowed in the United States starting from January 1, 2020.
